titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. George Myall, Judgment
CWG4783

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Mason Circuit Court
April Term 1864
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plf.
Against } Judgment
Jonas ^George^ Myall Deft.

"This day came the defendant into open Court and plead Guilty to the indictment and thereupon came a jury to wit: Amos Cullen, Thomas J Calvert, George Wood, Joseph J. Mefford, Charles Bland, Austin White, William Osborne, William Jacobs, William Higgins, James Curtis and John Prather who were duly sworn and having retired to their room returned the following verdict to wit: "We the jury find the defendant guilty and place his fine twenty dollars". (signed) Joseph. J. Mefford Foreman
Wherefore it is adjudged by the Court that the plaintiff recover of said defendant the sum of Twenty dollars, as a fine, all also her costs herein expended.

A Copy Attest
Jno M Duke jr Clerk
Mason Circuit Court.

Mason Cir Ct
Comlth of Ky
vs } Copy Judgment
Jonas ^George^ Myall

Remit except fees & costs
Apl 20th 1864
Thos E Bramlette
$20 --
